org.dudss.nodeshot.terrain

Class Section

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dudss.nodeshot.terrain.Section

  • public class Section
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a rectangular grid of Chunks with a fixed size (Base.SECTION_SIZE). It also holds terrain and corruption Mesh data for this particular map section.

    • Field Summary

      void setActive(boolean active)
      Flags the section as active which means that as long as there is a Chunk with Chunk.creeper > 0, the section Chunks are going to be updated by the SimulationThread.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Section

        public Section(Chunk[][] chunks)
        Section is an object representing a square grid of chunks with a fixed size. It also holds vertex info about under laying chunk terrain and corruption.
        Parameters:
        chunks - Chunks that form this Section. The array size must be the same as Base.SECTION_SIZE.

    • Method Detail

      • getChunk

        public Chunk getChunk(int x,
                      int y)
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate
        y - coordinate
        Returns:
        A Chunk at coordinates relative to the bottom left Section corner

      • setChunks

        public void setChunks(Chunk[][] chunks)
        Sets the section chunks array

      • updateAll

        public void updateAll()
        Sends an update call to every Chunk in this section. Also determines if this section needs further updates.
        Since:
        v5.1 (3.12.18) Part of the corruption optimisation update.

      • applyUpdates

        public void applyUpdates()
        Calls the Chunk.applyUpdate() method for every Chunk in the section.

      • updateNeighbours

        public void updateNeighbours()

      • updateTerrainMesh

        public void updateTerrainMesh(float[] verts,
                              short[] indices)
        Updates the Section terrain mesh data. Can be called from other threads. The actual terrain terrainMesh will not be updated directly. Use in combination with requestTerrainUpdate() to request terrainMesh update from the OpenGL draw thread.

      • getTerrainVerts

        public float[] getTerrainVerts()

      • getTerrainIndices

        public short[] getTerrainIndices()

      • getTerrainMesh

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh getTerrainMesh()
        Returns:
        The sections terrainMesh

      • updatedTerrain

        public void updatedTerrain()
        Nullifies the requestTerrainUpdate() call. Flags the terrainMesh as updated

      • requestTerrainUpdate

        public void requestTerrainUpdate()
        Requests terrainMesh update from the OpenGL draw thread. The mesh cannot be updated directly because OpenGL context is single-threaded.

      • needsTerrainUpdate

        public boolean needsTerrainUpdate()
        Returns:
        Whether the terrainMesh update is requested

      • updateCorruptionMesh

        public void updateCorruptionMesh(float[] verts,
                                 short[] indices)
        Updates the Section corruption mesh data. Can be called from other threads. The actual corruption mesh will not be updated directly. Use in combination with requestCorruptionUpdate() to request corruption mesh update from the OpenGL draw thread.

      • getCorruptionVerts

        public float[] getCorruptionVerts()

      • getCorruptionIndices

        public short[] getCorruptionIndices()

      • getCorruptionMesh

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh getCorruptionMesh()
        Returns:
        The sections corruption mesh of this Section.

      • updatedCorruptionMesh

        public void updatedCorruptionMesh()
        Nullifies the requestCorruptionUpdate() call. Flags the corruption mesh as updated.

      • requestCorruptionUpdate

        public void requestCorruptionUpdate()
        Requests a corruption mesh update from the OpenGL draw thread. The mesh cannot be updated directly because OpenGL context is single-threaded.

      • needsCorruptionMeshUpdate

        public boolean needsCorruptionMeshUpdate()
        Returns:
        Whether the corruption mesh needs update.

      • updateFogOfWarMesh

        public void updateFogOfWarMesh(float[] verts,
                               short[] indices)
        Updates the Section FogOfWar mesh data. Can be called from other threads. The actual FogOfWar mesh will not be updated directly. Use in combination with requestFogOfWarUpdate() to request FogOfWar mesh update from the OpenGL draw thread.

      • getFogOfWarVerts

        public float[] getFogOfWarVerts()

      • getFogOfWarIndices

        public short[] getFogOfWarIndices()

      • getFogOfWarMesh

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh getFogOfWarMesh()
        Returns:
        The sections FogOfWar mesh of this Section.

      • updatedFogOfWarMesh

        public void updatedFogOfWarMesh()
        Nullifies the requestFogOfWarUpdate() call. Flags the FogOfWar mesh as updated.

      • requestFogOfWarUpdate

        public void requestFogOfWarUpdate()
        Requests a FogOfWar mesh update from the OpenGL draw thread. The mesh cannot be updated directly because OpenGL context is single-threaded.

      • needsFogOfWarMeshUpdate

        public boolean needsFogOfWarMeshUpdate()
        Returns:
        Whether the FogOfWar mesh update is requested.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean active)
        Flags the section as active which means that as long as there is a Chunk with Chunk.creeper > 0, the section Chunks are going to be updated by the SimulationThread.
        Since:
        v5.1 (3.12.18) Part of the corruption optimisation update.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Since:
        v5.1 (3.12.18) Part of the corruption optimisation update.
        See Also:
        setActive(boolean)
